intro: Tylophora sootepensis, commonly known as the Sootep tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
